Package GameOfLife

Class boardGen

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameOfLife.boardGen
  • public class boardGen
extends java.lang.Object
    The boardGen class is one of the helper functions of the GOL class. This class is responsible for generating all fo the baords from the initial board.

    • Method Detail

      • writeBoard

        public static void writeBoard​(java.lang.String filename,
                              byte[][] grid)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        The function below is responsible for writing a grid to a file with the proper format so it can be accepted by the main program.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file that is getting written too.
        grid - a filled grid that will be written to the file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - throws exception if the file is not valid.

      • getIndex

        public static int getIndex​(int num,
                           int mod)
        The function below is responsible for calculating the desired index. This function is used to account for "wrapping around" the board
        Parameters:
        num - the index the user is looking for
        mod - the number of rows/columns in the grid
        Returns:
        returns the index and accounts for wrapping around the grid.

      • save

        public static void save​(java.lang.String filename,
                        byte[][] grid,
                        int tick)
        The function below is used save a single tick to the respective file.
        Parameters:
        filename - Used to save the files to the filename the user specified.
        grid - a byte[][] that represents the grid for a current tick
        tick - the tick that is being saved.

      • boardRunner

        public static void boardRunner​(byte[][] igrid,
                               int ticks,
                               int row,
                               int col)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        The baordRunner function is used to run the simulation. This function will take the initial board, the number fo rows, columns and ticks, and will use the list of MiniBoard objects to implement the multithreading. A while loop is used to run each tick. At each call, all of the miniboards are ran and follow the rules to determine whether a cell lives or dies. At the end of each iteration fo the loop, the larger reference board is updated by using the mini boards.
        Parameters:
        igrid - a byte[][] that represents the grid
        ticks - the tick that is being saved.
        row - the number of rows in the grid
        col - the number of columns in the grid.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if there are no miniboards or if theyre invalid.
